channel.title: NPR Topics: News
channel.description: NPR news, audio, and podcasts. Coverage of breaking stories, national and world news, politics, business, science, technology, and extended coverage of major national and world events.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: For first time in decades, U.S. says Colombia is falling short in drug war
item.description: For the first time in decades, the U.S. has decertified Colombia as a drug control partner — a symbolic blow to one of Washington's closest allies in Latin America.
item.content:encoded:
For the first time in decades, the U.S. has decertified Colombia as a drug control partner — a symbolic blow to one of Washington's closest allies in Latin America.

(Image credit: Fernando Vergara)
item.dc:creator: Alfie Pannell

item.title: JD Vance vows to carry on Kirk's legacy. And, the Fed meets to decide interest rates.
item.description: Vice President Vance hosted Charlie Kirk's podcast yesterday and vowed to carry on his friend's political legacy. And, the Federal Reserve meets to decide interest rates.
item.content:encoded:
Vice President Vance hosted Charlie Kirk's podcast yesterday and vowed to carry on his friend's political legacy. And, the Federal Reserve meets to decide interest rates.

(Image credit: Pool)
item.dc:creator: Suzanne Nuyen

item.title: Donald Trump files $15 billion defamation lawsuit against The New York Times
item.description: President Donald Trump filed a $15 billion defamation lawsuit against The New York Times and four of its journalists on Monday, according to court documents.
item.content:encoded:
President Donald Trump filed a $15 billion defamation lawsuit against The New York Times and four of its journalists on Monday, according to court documents.

(Image credit: Mary Altaffer)
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press

item.title: Is telehealth a good idea, or should I see my regular doctor?
item.description: Social media is full of their colorful ads, but are online doctors legit? Here's the lowdown on the pros and cons of online medicine.
item.content:encoded: Social media is full of their colorful ads, but are online doctors legit? Here's the lowdown on the pros and cons of online medicine.
item.dc:creator: Mara Gordon

item.title: On 9/16/25, celebrate a date of mathematical beauty
item.description: Pythagorean Triple Square Day, as one man affectionately calls 9/16/25, is a day like no other this century.
item.content:encoded:
Pythagorean Triple Square Day, as one man affectionately calls 9/16/25, is a day like no other this century.

(Image credit: marekuliasz/iStockphoto)
item.dc:creator: Ari Daniel

item.title: Kennedy's vaccine panel expected to recommend delaying hepatitis B shot in children
item.description: RFK Jr.'s hand-picked panel of vaccine advisors is expected to vote to delay the hepatitis B shot for newborns. Doctors warn that could fuel a return of a disease virtually eradicated in U.S. kids.
item.content:encoded:
RFK Jr.'s hand-picked panel of vaccine advisors is expected to vote to delay the hepatitis B shot for newborns. Doctors warn that could fuel a return of a disease virtually eradicated in U.S. kids. 

(Image credit: Rebecca Blackwell)
item.dc:creator: Jackie Fortiér

item.title: FBI Director Patel set to testify on Capitol Hill amid questions over his leadership
item.description: Kash Patel's appearance in the Senate comes at a delicate time for the director, who is a loyalist of President Trump but has no experience leading an organization like the FBI.
item.content:encoded:
Kash Patel's appearance in the Senate comes at a delicate time for the director, who is a loyalist of President Trump but has no experience leading an organization like the FBI.

(Image credit: Tom Williams)
item.dc:creator: Ryan Lucas

item.title: On Texas border, uninsured people stress the health system. It's set to get worse
item.description: In South Texas' Rio Grande Valley, many people go without health insurance, and the health system struggles as a result. Similar communities dot the nation.
item.content:encoded:
In South Texas' Rio Grande Valley, many people go without health insurance, and the health system struggles as a result. Similar communities dot the nation.

(Image credit: Sam Whitehead)
item.dc:creator: Sam Whitehead

item.title: Israel's military says its expanded operation in Gaza City has begun
item.description: The announcement by the Israeli military further escalated the Israel-Hamas war as any potential ceasefire feels even further out of reach despite weeks of diplomacy.
item.content:encoded:
The announcement by the Israeli military further escalated the Israel-Hamas war as any potential ceasefire feels even further out of reach despite weeks of diplomacy.

(Image credit: Leo Correa)
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press

item.title: Trump says the U.S. military targeted a boat allegedly carrying drugs from Venezuela
item.description: President Trump said the U.S. military on Monday again targeted a boat allegedly carrying drugs from Venezuela, killing three aboard the vessel.
item.content:encoded:
President Trump said the U.S. military on Monday again targeted a boat allegedly carrying drugs from Venezuela, killing three aboard the vessel.

(Image credit: Jesus Vargas)
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press
